title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 is cited in Section 1. Section 2 provides definitions. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Arts Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges. Tribally controlled community colleges are defined by the Tribal Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978 as post-secondary vocational institutions. Tribally controlled vocational institutions are defined by the Tribal Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990. Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions have SEC. 3 land grant status. Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions, such as the Institute, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, and Haskell Indian Junior College, are considered land-grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanical arts according to the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. The Act of July 2, 1862, amended provisions applicable to land-grant colleges in the United States and its territories. Any provision of a congressional act relating to assistance to these colleges shall apply to them. The Mariana Islands shall apply to the land-grant colleges and institutions in the same manner and to the same extent. Authorization of appropriations. In lieu of extending to the colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) those provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, relating to donations of public land or land scrip for the. Authorized appropriations of $10,000,000 for tribal colleges and institutions for the endowment and maintenance of colleges for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts. Amounts appropriated pursuant to this section shall be considered as grants to such colleges and institutions subject to the provisions of the applicable Act. The provisions of the Act applicable to the proceeds from the sale of land or land scrip. The Act titled "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993" defines the term used in the legislation. The "1994 Institutions" referred to in the Act include various community colleges such as Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, Dullknife Memorial College, Fond Du Lac Community College, Fort Belknap Community College, Fort Berthold Community College, Fort Peck Community College, Lac Courte Orielles Ojibwa Community College, Little Big Horn Community College, Little Hoop Community College, and Nebraska Indian Community College. The list of Native American community colleges includes Little Hoop Community College, Nebraska Indian Community College, Northwest Indian College, Oglala Lakota College, Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, Stonechild Community College, Turtle Mountain Community College, Navajo Community College, United Tribes Technical College, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, and Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development. Crownpoint Institute of Technology, Haskell Indian Junior College, Leech Lake Tribal College, and College of the Menominee Nation are Native American community colleges. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts in accordance with the Act of July 2, 1862. Provisions of Acts of Congress related to land-grant colleges apply to 1994 Institutions in various regions. The Northern Mariana Islands shall apply provisions to 1994 Institutions similar to land-grant colleges, with exceptions for certain Acts of Congress related to agricultural research funding. Authorization of appropriations is also addressed. Authorization of $23,000,000 in appropriations to 1994 Institutions in place of extending provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862 for donations of public land. Amounts granted subject to provisions applicable to land sales. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include additional funding for 1994 Institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to provide additional funding for 1994 Institutions, with specific instructions on how the funds should be allocated. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to authorize annual appropriations of $5,000,000 for the 1994 Institutions starting from the fiscal year ending June 30, 1995. The funds will be distributed through a competitive application process developed by the Secretary to State institutions. The Act of July 2, 1862 (12 Stat. 503, chapter 130; 7 U.S.C. 301 et seq.) allows institutions to administer funds through cooperative agreements with 1994 Institutions without a matching requirement. SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture. The Research Facilities Act is amended to provide $1,700,000 in grants for 1994 Institutions for research purposes in agriculture and sciences. The title is amended to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
